main event: A small white light was observed traveling at high speed, approximately twice the speed of echo-sounded aircraft, passing overhead on July 27, 1963.
interesting points: The object was described as a bright star, about the size of a small star, hovering in the sky., The object traveled south-southeast and was visible for approximately 2 minutes., The observer thought it might be a high flying jet due to the lack of sound., The sky was clear, and most stars were visible during the observation., The object did not exhibit any changes in color, size, or shape throughout the event.
witness description: Student near residence on Flemingsburg Road
